website_summaries.verdict: With a wide opening and integrated dryer arms, this reservoir is as easy to clean as it is to fill.
pros: Integrated dryer arms fold out for easy, faster drying
cons: Cap can be difficult to line up and drips if you don't get it right

customer_reviews.title: Makes me weak in the knees
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for something from oh... 2003? And let me say HOLY CRAP IT'S AMAZING. Such an upgrade in every way. I've bragged about it (yeah, my reservoir) to people I hike with because it's so impressive. Just snap on new tubes! Only a quarter turn to tighten! Slimmer profile! Lighter weight! Ugh it's great and I've got it in my same bag I've had since 2003. Awesome company in terms of their products (all I know, maybe they kill environments and throw babies into space. IDK)
customer_reviews.author: Misterwilliger

customer_reviews.title: Love This!
customer_reviews.text: You cant go wrong with the name brand of camelbacks, they are a much nicer quality than most of the competition. The mouth piece operates nicely and has a pretty high flow rate. The 100oz size is nice because it still fits in my small camelback backpack, but has a much larger capacity than the 1L bag it came with. We actually use these in our race cars to provide the drivers with cold water during our 2.5hr road races. They stand up the the G's , heat and vibrations that a race car produces. Great Product! If you found this review helpful please click the "I found this review helpful " button.
customer_reviews.author: Meintii

customer_reviews.title: Best for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this exact one ordered in 2012, for 7 years. It has been a great item. I have made some adjustments as in adding some couplings in the hose so I can filter water directly into the main reservoir without taking bag out. But other than that it has been flawless. But last trip it seems to have started leaking. I know these aren't forever bangs and I have more than overfilled it numerous times, it has hiked literally thousands of miles. So it's just time to bite the bullet and grab another.
customer_reviews.author: WrightReviews

customer_reviews.title: Bad O-ring.
customer_reviews.text: I took this camelbak on a monthlong trip to the hottest deserts of the US and the o-ring began to leak 2 and a half weeks into the trip. I had to use flagging tape which was all i had to stop 90% of the leak. I still had to wrap it in a towel and put a trash bag over it to make sure it didnt leak in my pack. Im returning this and asking for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: EnriqueU

customer_reviews.title: Great bladder with enough capacity for all but the hardest days.
customer_reviews.text: Three liters is perfect for a long day of backpacking in the mountains. I love this and bought it as an upgrade from a two liter bladder I used backpacking the year before. I love how you can connect a filter tube directly to the bag and fill it all the way. In fact, this is the only way to completely fill this bladder, as the opening is large and a little awkward to close. The closure ring can also help prop the bag open to dry at the end of your trip. Overall, this is a pleasure to use.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: it still fit and was fine, but I ended up giving it to my ...
customer_reviews.text: This has worked well since I got it. It was a bit tall for my backpack ,it still fit and was fine, but I ended up giving it to my husband for his pack which is slightly taller and it fits perfect. He loves it. I have since ordered the lumbar version of this one to fit better for my pack size. I love camelbak products and quality and their guarantee. I did see other reviews about a funny taste ... the first time I fillled it the first few sips did taste like a plastic tastes but since then nothing but water.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement for my old hydration bladders
customer_reviews.text: The updated quarter turn opening makes this a breeze to fill, the lip handle also makes it easy to manuever when filling with ice etc. I also like the detachable hose connector, which makes it easy to swap out the neoprene hose when I'm skiing and the regular one when I'm hiking. There wasnt a bad plastic taste and the material was sturdy yet flexible. It also fits perfectly in my hydration pack. I would have given it 5 stars, but I feel like cleaning this thing out is still a challenge and I wish the hose attachment would pivot so I could have more options on how it was in my bag.
customer_reviews.author: HP

customer_reviews.title: It was awesome. Then I got drunk and put it in ...
customer_reviews.text: I put white rum in it and went out and partied. It was awesome. Then I got drunk and put it in the closet and forgot about it for 3 years. The rum f'd it up and now it wont work. My fault though. Camelbak rocks. Their waterbottles are good too!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Papagiorgio

customer_reviews.title: Proven! No leaks....just take a few extra seconds to make sure it's sealed correctly.
customer_reviews.text: At times you just have to go with the proven brand. I know a lot of reviews talk about the new locking mechanism being faulty and causing leaks. I haven't experience such event. I do believe it requires a few extra seconds to make sure you insert the lid correctly, it's pressed down completely and then turned to it's locked position. There's a reason it has the locked/unlocked markings, no hassle. So, moral of the story great great product that requires a few extra seconds to make sure no mess is caused later one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Castro

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and secure (once properly installed). Keeps water cool.
customer_reviews.text: Works great as a water reservoir for hikes. Supper convenient, more capacity than the standard 70 oz, keep water cool and on hand. I recently took this on a 5+ hr hike in Hawai'i and was the only one with cold water through-out the hike. I kept this in a older North Face Surge backpack. As ome others have said, it is difficult to line-up and twist on the lid, but it is very secure and leak free if you get it on correctly. Check this as it can look installed but not seated perfectly. I would give 4.5 stars if I could (for the lid issue).
customer_reviews.author: SamTop Contributor: Baseball

customer_reviews.title: The Good, The Bad and the Fragile
customer_reviews.text: The Good: The detachable hose on these new bladders are great The Bad: Maybe it is just me, but I find the "improved" 1/4 turn closure way harder to seat and close than the original closure. Just seems like the old one I just spun in. This one I have to fiddle with to get it straight so I can close it. The Fragile: The little arms that hold the bladder open when it dries are a good feature, but it won't be long before I snap them off. Just flimsey One more gripe - it is pictured with the drying hanger, but it doesn't come with the bladder. It should
customer_reviews.author: Halljp

customer_reviews.title: Great Hydration
customer_reviews.text: I have a Camelbak backpack and a hiking pack with a place for hydration bags. (it will hold 2 of these) I bought this because it will work with both packs, and I prefer this design to most others. I like the bite valve, and the screw close opening for filling. I also like the baffle that runs up the middle which helps keep it flatter when full. I had one for a while, and liked it well enough to buy another. I'm very happy with the quality and design.
customer_reviews.author: M FN K

customer_reviews.title: Adding ice into the Camelbak is very easy to do with the wide mouth
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this Camelback after purchasing a cheap water bladder from Walmart. The difference in quality between the two is night and day and well worth the extra money. Adding ice into the Camelbak is very easy to do with the wide mouth. But by far the most impressive feature is the valve where you actually drink the water. With the cheap one, it was very hard to get water through and I often felt winded afterwards. With this Camelback I am able to get lots of water with minimal effort. Having a 100 oz of water on days in Disneyland has been so nice that I purchased a second one for my wife
customer_reviews.author: BIGRYNO16

customer_reviews.title: My preferred reservoir
customer_reviews.text: Only used it a handful of times, but have not ran into any of the issues with leaking. It may have leaked once, from the lid, but all I had to do was put it on properly and make sure it was snug. No issues with leaking from bite valve, or from tube connection. Wide mouth makes it easy to clean. I do make sure to wipe it out as soon as possible, once I do empty it.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy B

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, easy to fill, big enough for a long day hike.
customer_reviews.text: works great! I love hiking with this. It's my first camelback and I will continue to use it! There is a quite pronounced plastic taste but if you add a little bit of lemon juice in the water, you almost don't feel it. For a day long hike, I took this camelback + a small back-up (75cl) because you don't know how much water is left unless to take it out of your bag-pack...
customer_reviews.author: Christophe

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, slight plasticy taste.
customer_reviews.text: I don't really have any experience with hydration bladders to compare this to. So far, this seems to be a great bladder. There are only 2 downsides I've had: * Tastes a bit plasticy. Not too bad, but the taste is there. * Annoying to dry out. Hanging it up caused the whole thing to basically seal up. Had to stuff paper towels in it to keep it open. Other than that, it's a fine water carrier. The hose works great and is plenty long enough for whatever you'll use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Jake S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for long hikes! Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my trip to Peru and it worked wonderfully! I didn't buy the fancy backpack and instead just put it in the back of my current back-pack, which worked well. Just make sure to wash it properly after each use, so it doesn't produce mildew. It was easy to disassemble each piece. Great quality and I would recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I bought one and went to use it without testing it. It leaked all over my backpack. I was so displeased. Called Amazon and they replaced it no problem. The second one was not flawed and I have used it multiple times. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Breanna Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Its the best bag.
customer_reviews.text: Its the best bag...slows bacteria growth, holds lots, wide mouth for ice,wide mouthpiece, arms to hold it open for drying (if you can find em. ) 5 stars if the hose was wider. I replace the hose with wider to increase flow. Easier flow means more water per drink and less dehydration. (if flow is slow you just quiet drinking as much due to time and effort. sounds looney but true.)
customer_reviews.author: slickrockdude

customer_reviews.title: No leaks but design could be better
customer_reviews.text: Mine doesn't leak fortunately enough, but I could see how it's a problem for other people. I don't believe the cap is a very good design because it takes me a couple of tries to make sure it's on correctly and tight, so definitely understandable why people are experiencing leaks. The mouth-piece doesn't stay on the hose very well for me either. I have kids and there's been a few times where they mildly tugged on the mouthpiece only to have the hose disconnect it from it. Other than that it works pretty well and a good price!
customer_reviews.author: Julian Sisko

customer_reviews.title: Nicely improved design, but still a bit of of a plastic taste.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace old bladders as this was supposed to have less of a plastic taste. Yeah, not so much. Still tastes plastics...although not nearly as bad as my 10 year old camelback. New lid style is nice...quick to remove and wider and easier to fill. Removable hose makes it easier to clean too. Still a good replacement, just not the taste free quality I was hoping for. And yes, I tried the baking soda soak.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Berfel

customer_reviews.title: Design still works well
customer_reviews.text: Camelbak has come out with a new Reservoir, the Crux. The Crux has a different design and won't fit my hydration pack. Bought this as a backup as I love my Camelbak reservoir and my current hydration pack. If Camelbak is going to continue this old Antidote design it would be nice to at least start making them with the wider diameter Crux tubing.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Nothing like OE replacements.
customer_reviews.text: These reservoirs are good stuff. I carry my hydration pack almost every day, and although they are durable, after a while these things can develop holes and leaks. Fortunately, they're easy to get replacements for. The big mouth fills easy, the large tube supplies a lot of water quickly, and doesn't leak when I don't want water running everywhere. Other products just don't work as well or last as long.
customer_reviews.author: Cotharyus

customer_reviews.title: Nice improvement over the last model
customer_reviews.text: My old bladder was due for replacement, and this was the most affordable 100oz I could find. The new cap is nice (only needs a 1/4 turn to close it), but my favorite feature so far is the quick-disconnect on the tube connection. I don't have to de-thread my tube when I take the bag out. I just disconnect the bag, and the valve closes behind it locking the water inside. The only think I don't like is the spine connecting the front and back of the bladder... it makes it more difficult to clean and dry. However, it does prevent the bag from bulging when full, making it easier to insert into the pack.
customer_reviews.author: C. Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: No leaks for me
customer_reviews.text: I just took this backpacking over a few days and had no leaks. Of course I tested it filling with watre and playing the drums. With the cap screwed on properly there were no issues. The only real issue I had was the tube is too short. I added a quick link connector near the mouthpiece so I could extend the length and make it easy to pump filtered stream water. I trusted it for my outing and did not regret it. Just test before you go and you should be cool
customer_reviews.author: BigMontana

customer_reviews.title: I bring this to every hike over 7 miles (and ...
customer_reviews.text: I bring this to every hike over 7 miles (and I hike almost every weekend, even in the winter). I clean it after EVERY use. and I hang dry it for several days until it is completely dry. If you know how to care for your camelbak, it will last you a very long time. I have been using this particular one for over a year now.
customer_reviews.author: K.tin

customer_reviews.title: So far this has been the best bladder I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been the best bladder I've ever had. I always have issues with bladders leaking. I am doing a trip to Kilimanjaro, and I didn't want leaking on a freezing mountain (or ever). I have used this bladder a few times, and even let the bladder sit with water for a few days, and still no leakage. I would recommend this for anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Denae

customer_reviews.title: Does its job well! Weird taste on spout.
customer_reviews.text: This bladder is really great! My boyfriend and I go hiking every weekend and we each have a bladder. It holds enough water to keep us hydrated for 6 hours of hiking. It hasn't leaked either. The only negative, I think, is the weird chemical taste to the spout. I'm hoping it wears off eventually, but as of this writing it's still there, if slight.
customer_reviews.author: patrice

customer_reviews.title: The water also stayed cool to drink and was not hot except in the ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this Hydration Bladder to put in my day pack and it fit perfectly. Did some hiking in the Smoky Mountains and this provided me with plenty of water to keep hydrated. I drank a lot of the contents on the first hike into the mountains as it was a very hot day in August. The water also stayed cool to drink and was not hot except in the exposed drinking tube. Easy to clean and store. I store mine in the freezer so the help prevent any bacteria growth, you just have to be careful with the drinking tube when removing from the freezer as it can get very brittle. Excellent item.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Cannot Go Wrong with Camelbak
customer_reviews.text: Perfect replacement bladder from Camelbak. I have used Camelbak products for years now. Only one was replaced due to a manufacturing error. You cannot go wrong with Camelbak in my experience. Oh and why did I need a replacement? Forgot to clean it out and after 5 months in storage it was a great excuse to get a replacement :).
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Courter

customer_reviews.title: Better taste in cooler weather
customer_reviews.text: I love it, but the water will taste like the plastic when you take it out in the heat. Unsure if this is even a fixable issue, but it does put a damper on usability since I hike in the arid Texas heat. May be better suited for cooler environments, but gets the job done if you don't mind sacrificing taste for good hydration on hikes.
customer_reviews.author: James and Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Really happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this product! Nice, durable with good capacity. No leaks! Also I really like new design, I bought it as a gift for my husband (he had an old version). I also have this reservoir but smaller size. Great for hiking and biking.
customer_reviews.author: Yana K.

customer_reviews.title: Made Water Taste Horrible
customer_reviews.text: This bag made the water taste horrible. I tried to clean it a few times, but the new, rubber smell would not go away, just wasted my bottled water. Finally, my bag was stolen, so I didn't have to suffer with it any more. My original Camelbak did not have this problem, not sure what happened with this one.
customer_reviews.author: JustReviewin'

customer_reviews.title: Another great Camelbak product
customer_reviews.text: Camelbak continues to be at the forefront of hydration packs. I bought this bladder to replace a worn bladder on my 12 year old Camelbak HAWG. I was surprised to see how many improvements they have made to what seems like such a simple device. I will be a customer for life.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Antidote is a good all around bladder
customer_reviews.text: Yesterday I field tested both the CamelBak Omega and Antidote 100 Oz. hydration bladders. The Antidote is a good all around bladder. Excellent construction. the drinking system and mouthpiece were average. It kept my water cool for the entire day on a 18.5 mile hike. I would recommend to anyone who requires or is looking for an entry level hydration bladder.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: It leaks from the cover. My older one didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: It leaks from the cover. My older one didn't leak at all. I don't know can I return it or not since it has been too long. It is my fault that I didn't check the product right after I got it..:( So my advice is please check if the bag is leaking as soon as you can and maybe you can exchange one or return.
customer_reviews.author: taochuchun

customer_reviews.title: The size on this is great for longer hikes
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a few different brands of bladders, and none come close to the Camelbak ones. The size on this is great for longer hikes, and the attachment system is the easiest to use of any i have tried. I know the price is a bit higher, but it's worth it for the ease of use, the ease to clean these, and the connection system.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rathbun

customer_reviews.title: Great water bladder
customer_reviews.text: Excellent water bladder. The best I've had. Large 3L size, baffled, easy filling and cleaning. Tube removes easily for draining and cleaning. Mouth piece is comfortable and easy to drink from
customer_reviews.author: D. Pangal

customer_reviews.title: Improved version, does the trick, could improve more
customer_reviews.text: Has some improvements over older versions, such as the 'unclippable' water hose and two retractable plastic sticks that keep the bag open while drying. However, it'd be great if they can include the same mechanism for the mouthpiece as it typically is slower to dry and can accumulate mold.
customer_reviews.author: F Spin

customer_reviews.title: It meets my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Performs as expected. I use my Camelback for Hiking, biking, and motorcycle riding. This was the newer version of the reservoir which fits perfectly in my pack. It looks like it will last as long as my last reservoir.
customer_reviews.author: Rayneman5

customer_reviews.title: Loved the volume of the pack
customer_reviews.text: Loved the volume of the pack, the ease of filling the device, and the snap-top seal. Disappointed by my pak leaking right out of the box. Turns out I have to pay the S&H to send the product in to have it replaced? Feel like Camelbak should pay for S&H for a defect of THEIR product, not me...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A quality bladder
customer_reviews.text: I stick with the original for now, they have really improved the design over the years. The baffle in the middle really ridgidizes it, & helps it dry a bit easier. It does have the "bladder" or "tube" taste, but it didn't get any funkier over the 10 days of use. Going to look into those chemical tabs to put in your bladders to get rid of chemicals... ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Williams

customer_reviews.title: This is a great item to use not only when on hikes and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item to use not only when on hikes and bike rides. My son is working all day long in un-air-conditioned summer/hot heat and he's got his backpack on with this filled and can sip all day long. Well worth the money. The only drawback is it does have a plastic taste. I'm hoping this will subside once he's used it for a bit.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hepler

customer_reviews.title: It holds water and works great. I choose Camelback reservoirs because they have a ...
customer_reviews.text: It holds water and works great. I choose Camelback reservoirs because they have a handle to help you hold the reservoir while filling it that others do not. They also close easier and faster than other brands. But it's Camelbak, so not a big shock that it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Dale B.

customer_reviews.title: I like the quick release for the tube making it easier ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace an ancient camelbak bladder i got with the backpack years ago. There have been a few improvements in their design since then. I like the quick release for the tube making it easier to air out after use. It's also easier to close the opening now.
customer_reviews.author: P. Abeles

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!!
customer_reviews.text: My old pouch was beyond repair after 6 years of very hard use. This cheap and official replacement is the same but seems to have been mildly revised...seems to feel more sturdy and seems thicker as well. I use one in an old Cambelbak Fourteener.
customer_reviews.author: Sean L.

customer_reviews.title: Works well to hold water while hiking.
customer_reviews.text: Works well to hold water while hiking. I had a slight issue with the straw popping off of the bag in my bag
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these and they are working perfectly. I use them for backpacking and love that the hoses are so easy to attach and detach for switching reservoirs. Even without the hose in, it doesn't leak! Perfect for any outdoor activity!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle M.

customer_reviews.title: So very disappointed and not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: So unhappy! I specifically bought the camelbak brand so that I was sure I wouldn't have any problems, specifically leakage, on my big hikes in July (over 100 degrees!) at Zion National Park. Unfortunately I trusted the brand too much and sure enough it leaked the first time I used it and continues to leak! It leaks around the circular opening where the bag connects (not the opening itself) and so any pressure on the bag (i.e. when putting it in my pack in the hydration specific pocket) forces water out and into my pack. So very disappointed and not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Garcia

customer_reviews.title: It works real well but tit has a bit of ...
customer_reviews.text: It works real well but tit has a bit of difficulty in closure. I have multiple thought it was locked only to leak. The last time was on a 10 mile ride and I left the water in the trunk of my car and only realized about 4 miles into my ride that I had run out of water. THIRSTY.
customer_reviews.author: Jeyasuria Pancharatnam

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Every Camelbak bladder I buy leaks after a few uses while the cheaper one I bought has lasted years.
customer_reviews.author: BobDoleRules

customer_reviews.title: Great but hard to clean/dry
customer_reviews.text: I used this for hiking and really like it. It doesn't leak and I love that you can turn the valve on and off. It fits perfectly in a backpack and holds enough for a long day of hiking. The only thing I don't like is that it is so hard to clean and dry after you use it. I watched some videos on the camelbak website with tips on how to clean and dry and that helped a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: GA

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable!
customer_reviews.text: This camelbak was leaking at the side seem after a week. I was on the trail with soaked gear. I will definitely buy it from a store next time so I can return it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its a camelbak, enough said
customer_reviews.text: The quick release is a brilliant addition for feeding the tube through the bag straps. The plastic seems tougher than the older models (without the quick release). The drier arms are a complete miss though. They are two plastic arms that pivot from the handle and are supposed to keep the camelbak open by squeezing it when extended. Packed up they wrap around the fill hole opening. They obviously didn't test it and should save themselves the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Great reservoir
customer_reviews.text: A great design. It has leaked once or twice, but I think it's typically how the threads get seated or the hose gets plugged in. My only complaint is I wish they'd figure out a way to drain it completely, instead of leaving water inside. Like maybe extend that plastic circular lip all the way to the edge and angle it down so the water can get out.
customer_reviews.author: FilmComposer

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly with Katadyn Hiker Pro filter; no funky chemical taste
customer_reviews.text: I tried to save money by buying an off brand, and I regret it. The off brand tasted like chemical cancer. No taste from the Camelbak (except the first time, but then never again--I really should have rinsed it better). FITS PERFECTLY WITH MY KATADYN HIKER PRO. No need for conversion kits other than the one that came with the Katadyn.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Boss

customer_reviews.title: Careful with the lid
customer_reviews.text: Quality water system for backpacking. Large enough for a days worth of water. Only negative is you have to be careful how you close it up. If you aren't really careful it will leak. At first glance. It looks and feels when you close it as it's lined up properly but that's not always the case. Which can lead to a backpacking disaster.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Great Camelback product
customer_reviews.text: This works great like all Camelbak products I've had. The plastic seems more rugged than a previous iteration of this. The little included rods that keep the reservoir open when drying are a nice touch and very convenient. Love Camelback products.
customer_reviews.author: Hammer of Truth

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Performs as it should. Fits in my non-camelbak pack just fine! I highly recommend this. You can't beat the quality, quick connect hose, and easy to use mouthpiece. This is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Miss PeabodiTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: I was really glad to see them improve upon the original
customer_reviews.text: Camelbak products are always top notch. They made a major improvement to this particular product. They added a quick release latch to the base connector that connects to the bladder. I was really glad to see them improve upon the original, as this feature makes it optimal for cleaning. The original did not have the quick release.
customer_reviews.author: sseleman

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Works fine. Wish it came with a bottle brush but no big deal. I made the mistake of putting bleach in my previous one (ruins it) so this is my replacement. Stood up to being beat up on a kayak trip and help up for use while snorkeling. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: LoraX

customer_reviews.title: Great size, used it when I rode in RAGBRAI ...
customer_reviews.text: Replacement for one I may have left water in over winter that got a little funky. Great size, used it when I rode in RAGBRAI in 2015, only having to stop like once per day for water refill was awesome. Even if it's for a short distance these will help keep you hydrated.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Suter

customer_reviews.title: The Reservoir Leaked
customer_reviews.text: The reservoir leaked at the mouth and hose connection to the reservoir.
customer_reviews.author: Preparing4SHTF

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: As with all camelbak products this is great! Love the bite valve and the quick disconnect hose. The big mouth fill opening is great for filling and cleaning. I have tried all the other top brands in hydration bladders but camelbak is my go to. It is designed with the user in mind at every turn and they are durable. I'm hard on stuff but their products last.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Adams

customer_reviews.title: Awesome screw on opening with a big lip that makes ...
customer_reviews.text: High quality material. Huge, sleek reservoir. Awesome screw on opening with a big lip that makes it easy to hole while filling up. Hose is easily detachable and high quality material. Mouthpiece and on/off valve VERY easy to use compared to competitors. I use this for all my festivals and I stay hydrated all day and never have problems. Camelback and do no wrong. A+ indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Mapp

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced fake product.
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this and I am pretty sure it is a Chinese knock off. The materials are thinner and not the same design as the one that I purchased from Camelbak a few years ago before they stopped making them and overall quality is not the same. Overpriced fake product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Deeter

customer_reviews.title: Great value - no more leaking issues!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this bladder once, and was very impressed. I was hesitant to purchase it based on other reviews about how it leaked when it was filled to capacity, but I had no leaking issues whatsoever. And it fits perfectly in my pack that previously housed my 2L bladder. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Gopher Love

customer_reviews.title: Great quality replacement
customer_reviews.text: Great quality replacement. I love the new filler cap and how the hose is easily detached for drying it out. To dry the main reservoir I place small plastic tupperware pieces inside to puff it up and allow air inside all the way to the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Toph

customer_reviews.title: Worked Flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: This CamelBak Antidote worked flawlessly for me on a day (11 hour) hike. I used it in a Osprey Talon 33 and it fit great. No leaks. Just be sure to use the guide marks on the cover to insert and close it.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Love this. I have two different sized ones
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I have two different sized ones. I use this for my long trips, and always have fresh water.
customer_reviews.author: Linda H

customer_reviews.title: Take care of your Camelbak and you won't' need this ...
customer_reviews.text: Take care of your Camelbak and you won't' need this. I tried everything including bleach to get the nasty out of my old one. This is the only real solution for a nasty mold filled Camelbak.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE the camelbak
customer_reviews.text: LOVE the camelbak! It tastes a bit funky the first few times you use it (even after washing multiple times) but the taste does fade with time. No leaks, no other issues!
customer_reviews.author: Melany

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for backpacking and day hiking
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for backpacking and day hiking! I can just take it out of one backpack and slide it into another without any issues. You have to be careful to twist it shut correctly or else water leaks out (my fault for not checking it was lined up). I love this bladder! I cut it and hooked up my Sawyer water filtration system to it and it works great for that too on backpacking trips.
customer_reviews.author: Erica blanton

customer_reviews.title: Strong material
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I was scared to put it against my back because I had 45lbs worth of stuff in my backpack so I thought it would pop, but it was fine throughout my 3 day trip. Recommend to all bacjpackers. Its honestly so convienent to have. Never have to stop to get out water.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Awesome water reservoir
customer_reviews.text: Despite what others have said, I have not found any leaks yet. And I filled it up and shook the crap out of it. We had some crap get into the water we filtered and made everything taste weird on a trip. But i got home and lightly rinsed it out and you can't tell anything. Pretty good liner to keep any lasting tastes out. Solid buy, good price.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander J. Marowsky

customer_reviews.title: BEST Reservoir We've Seen and Had!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has one of these, and was trying to purchase another one for my son, until USPS delivery carrier discarded our packages, but this IS the BEST Reservior we've come across. It has the locking system, which we love, so that liquid doesn't leak out, and a huge, wide opening in order to place your hand inside to fully clean out the inside from built-up bacteria.
customer_reviews.author: BellaLatinaReina-ACP Zero-Nine-Five

customer_reviews.title: Great bladder, there is some plastic taste at first ...
customer_reviews.text: Great bladder, there is some plastic taste at first but as I have gotten through my first bit of the water the taste has gotten much less intense. It isn't difficult to fill and I really like it! Plus at the time I got it it was $10 less then REI! Yay!
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Great line of products. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Camelbak is a great line of hydration packs. The first bladder I had lasted 5 plus years. The replacement bladder I bought has a couple new improvements. It's easier to put the cap on and the straw detaches easier for cleaning purposes but is very secure when in use. I would recommend Camelbak to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer F.

customer_reviews.title: Camelbak
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the water reservoir in my pack and decided to get a larger size. It fits nicely in the camelbak pouch that was made for a 70oz. I don't go through all my water in one trip now! The hose is detachable without water leaking and the opening to fill it is a major upgrade from previous camelbak reservoirs. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: WOrks great!
customer_reviews.text: it works great with my camelbak. I love the wide opening! so much easier to deal with!
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my son to take on a 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son to take on a 5 week trip to Israel and he loves it. He said that it was a really life saver during a heat wave there and now he carries it in a back pack around NYC. I find that it is not too hard to clean out though I am concerned about mold in the tube.
customer_reviews.author: NP in NYC

customer_reviews.title: Money Well Spent
customer_reviews.text: Great Design, great feature set at a very good price point. This is a definite upgrade for my hiking gear. Fits perfectly in my backpack, the tube is just the right length - not way too long like the one it's replacing - and it holds enough water that I no longer feel the need for an extra bottle on the side.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Livingston

customer_reviews.title: Great bladder. Fills easy
customer_reviews.text: Great bladder. Fills easy, is made of thick material, the bite valve works well, the tube snaps off for easy cleaning, and it has built-in arms to help the drying-out process. One of my cats did put a hole in it, but a Park glueless patch took care of that.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G. Muller

customer_reviews.title: I fell almost 10 feet on this bag when it ...
customer_reviews.text: I fell almost 10 feet on this bag when it was full and it didn't rupture. That was it for me. I'm never buying anything else for a water bag.
customer_reviews.author: Levi Fay

customer_reviews.title: new bladder for older pack!
customer_reviews.text: still smells new and water has plastic taste, yet this is so easy to fill, and the removable hose is great! fits my old camel pack perfectly. very happy with it! especially the mouthpiece close valve makes leaks less likely!
customer_reviews.author: Lance W. Stromsoe

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for LOBO
customer_reviews.text: This unit was up to par from previous experience. I need a replacement, old one was neglected and just threw away. I use this for my 2 hour bike rides, Its plenty big for the ride. I like that the mouth piece now has a lock. I am considering a insulated hose now, this hose does warm up the water in the sun.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: so I bought this and it's great! Works as it should
customer_reviews.text: I had another reservoir, but I had taken the valve off to let the tube dry out (and clean the valve) and I think my cat ran off with the valve, because it disappeared. I couldn't find a replacement valve, so I bought this and it's great! Works as it should, no leaks.
customer_reviews.author: dsf

customer_reviews.title: It Leaks!
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try this product on my camping trip up in Lake Placid. Unfortunately, as other reviewers have pointed out, the bladders slowly leaks from the mouth when under any pressure. No way to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: SidRB

customer_reviews.title: Good Job
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement for my hydration pack inside my megamouth North Face, since NF does a pretty bad job at selling parts. Fits perfectly and the detatchable hose is quite nice. But as with all hydration packs you kind of have to worry about bacteria or mold build up in the mouth piece and other spots where water doesnt realy dry out too well. Other than that its a great product and replacement, I recomend it.
customer_reviews.author: Burn Sirv

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for MULE pack
customer_reviews.text: Have the older M.U.L.E camelbak and this bladder is a perfect replacement. Shipped fast and was reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J Pedrick

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: As always, this CamleBak product is excellent. I bought this for a daypack hydration bladder and it works wonderfully. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: GrizzledAtoms

customer_reviews.title: easy to clean/dry with the folding arms
customer_reviews.text: Can be difficult to tighten the lid while its completely full without spilling. Otherwise it survived a 3 day backpacking trip no problem, no leaks, easy to clean/dry with the folding arms. Great addition to any outdoor thrill seekers bag.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Have used this twice, no problems. No leaking, cap easily and securely screws into place. To keep bacteria from growing in it, I actually place it in the freezer between uses. I use it with the Sawyer 3-Way Inline Water Filter, so that I can simply dip it into a stream and fill it up, and not have to worry about getting sick.
customer_reviews.author: $ebastian

customer_reviews.title: Camelbak 100 oz Antidote Replacement
customer_reviews.text: Recommended. Good replacement for my original (8 yr old) 100oz reservoir. This one is a huge improvement thanks to the large fill hole. Easy to get ice into it and much easier to wash and air-dry out.
customer_reviews.author: turnergreen

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Doesn't leak (but sweats)
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Doesn't leak (but sweats). Opening is a little hard to work.
customer_reviews.author: jackets90

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: Heck yeah! Great water holder. You can fill it with ice, relatively easy to clean. You could probably get away with putting juice or Gatorade in here. I'm in love with it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a mule
customer_reviews.text: All is good. Just does fit into my M.U.L.E. pack. New easy-off lid is very nice. No leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Flexible, easy to fill but still gives water that plastic taste
customer_reviews.text: Fits great in the bag that I use for hiking and it's easy to fill but the plastic taste is still evident after multiple uses and it's still a pain to get it to dry without building up mildew (really long chopsticks help!).
customer_reviews.author: willworkforchange

customer_reviews.title: Excellent updates
customer_reviews.text: I'm a long time Camelbak user and I'm really happy with the new features. The quick release hose is a feature I've been wishing for So far it's not leaking, I hope it stays that way! I wasn't too sure about the new "spine" within the bladder, I thought cleaning would be more of a hassle, but it keeps it flatter and much easier to insert into the pack when filled. I've just been vigilant about emptying out and drying after rides to prevent it from getting gunky in the first place. So far no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Bikey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The new camelback design is way better then the old one. The quarter twist to open is gold.
customer_reviews.author: alexander

product_meta.title: CamelBak Antidote Reservoir 100 oz
product_meta.description: Upgrade or replace your 100 oz, 3L, reservoir with the Antidote Reservoir -- the ultimate cure for dehydration.
feature_bullets: Upgrade or replace your 100 oz (3L) CamelBak reservoir with the feature-rich Antidote Reservoir
Quick-snap cap tightens in just a quarter turn; low-profile fit for excellent stability; Air-light fillport cuts weight
Integrated dryer arms fold out for easy, faster drying; Quick Link system for easier loading and unloading
Three-liter (100-ounce) fluid capacity; measures seven by 17.5 inches (W x D) empty and 6.75 by 2.5 by 16.6 inches (W x H x D) full

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
